title: Here're the games leaving PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium in June
description: Following last week's PlayStation Plus catalogue additions for May, Sony has announced its next batch of departures, with Monster Hunter Rise and more all leaving the service in June. Read more
author: Matt Wales
excerpt: Following last week's PlayStation Plus catalogue additions for May, Sony has announced its next batch of departures, wiâ€¦
text: Monster Hunter Rise! Inscryption! More! Image credit: Capcom Following last week's PlayStation Plus catalogue additions for May, Sony has announced its next batch of departures, with Monster Hunter Rise and more all leaving the service in June. In total, PlayStation Plus' newly updated Last Chance to Play section confirms six titles are currently scheduled to be removed from the service next month, meaning the clock is ticking if you were hoping to see any of the following games' credits roll: Monster Hunter Rise Rogue Legacy 2 Inscryption After Us Kayak VR: Mirage Avicii Invector Rogue Legacy 2 v1.0 Launch Trailer Rogue Legacy 2 plays are great as it looks.Watch on YouTube The good news is it's a considerably smaller list compared to last month, when Sony jettisoned over 22 titles - including the likes of Grand Theft Auto 5, Batman: Arkham Knight, Payday 2, Ghostrunner, and Journey to the Savage Planet. But that's not to say none of June's removals will be missed; Monster Hunter Rise is a stellar entry in Capcom's long-running series, while Rogue Legacy 2 - with its jauntily compelling permadeath platform exploration - and the wonderfully sinister Inscryption both come highly recommended. And if you've managed to miss the news of PlayStation Plus' latest additions so far this month, these include Battlefield 5, Stalker: Legends of the Zone Trilogy, Humankind, and Sandland for Premium and Extra subscribers. Ark: Survival Ascended, Balatro, and Warhammer 40K: Boltgun, meanwhile, can be picked up across all three membership tiers. You can find more details in Eurogamer's full PlayStation Plus guide.
html:
Monster Hunter Rise! Inscryption! More!

Following last week's PlayStation Plus catalogue additions for May, Sony has announced its next batch of departures, with Monster Hunter Rise and more all leaving the service in June.

In total, PlayStation Plus' newly updated Last Chance to Play section confirms six titles are currently scheduled to be removed from the service next month, meaning the clock is ticking if you were hoping to see any of the following games' credits roll:

  • Monster Hunter Rise
  • Rogue Legacy 2
  • Inscryption
  • After Us
  • Kayak VR: Mirage
  • Avicii Invector

The good news is it's a considerably smaller list compared to last month, when Sony jettisoned over 22 titles - including the likes of Grand Theft Auto 5, Batman: Arkham Knight, Payday 2, Ghostrunner, and Journey to the Savage Planet. But that's not to say none of June's removals will be missed; Monster Hunter Rise is a stellar entry in Capcom's long-running series, while Rogue Legacy 2 - with its jauntily compelling permadeath platform exploration - and the wonderfully sinister Inscryption both come highly recommended.

And if you've managed to miss the news of PlayStation Plus' latest additions so far this month, these include Battlefield 5, Stalker: Legends of the Zone Trilogy, Humankind, and Sandland for Premium and Extra subscribers. Ark: Survival Ascended, Balatro, and Warhammer 40K: Boltgun, meanwhile, can be picked up across all three membership tiers. You can find more details in Eurogamer's full PlayStation Plus guide.
